titles.title: SSI Modernization Act of 2005
SSI Modernization Act of 2005
To update the supplemental security income program, and to increase incentives for working, saving, and pursuing an education.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Human Resources.

bill.summary:
SSI Modernization Act of 2005 - Amends title XVI (Supplemental Security Income) of the Social Security Act (SSA), with respect to eligibility and income determination requirements, to increase the excluded amount (adjusted for cost-of-living changes) of: (1) income per year other than income paid on the basis of the eligible individual's need; and (2) earned income per year for an individual (or the individual's spouse) who is blind and has not attained age 65.
Increases resource limits under SSA title XVI part A (Determination of Benefits) provisions concerned with the eligibility for and amount of benefits for each aged, blind, or disabled individual who does not have an eligible spouse.
Provides for disability redeterminations for secondary school students who turn age 18.
